events.name: Kernel and Platform track at FOSSASIA Summit 2018 (14 talks)
events.description: Dear Singapore Linux Kernel Developers, Come down to the 14 talks at the Kernel and Platform track at the FOSSASIA Summit 2018, Mar 22 - 25, FOSSASIA.SG @ Lifelong Learning Institute, Paya Lebar: https://2018.fossasia.org/event/tracks.html#Kernel%20&%20Platform There will be over 200 speakers form 47 countries, and 11 other tracks including Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Cloud and Blockchain. Learn more at https://fossasia.sg
events.location: Lifelong Learning Institute, 11 Eunos Road 8, Singapore

events.name: Launch of the Award Winning Sinterit Lisa SLS Desktop 3D Printer
events.description: Join us for the launch of the new Sinterit Lisa SLS Desktop 3D Printing System at 3D Printing Studios Asia in Singapore. This award winning product is the Most Affordable SLS 3D printing system in the market today. SLS 3D Printers are typically within the US$150K onwards price tag. The Sinterit Lisa is only a faction of that price! The print quality and finishing is above the rest of the other 3D printing technologies and comparable with other industrial SLS 3D printers. The Sinterit Lisa prints in both PA12 Nylon and Flexa Black TPU materials. Join us for the event and it is mandatory to RSVP your attendance by filling in the details from this form: https://goo.gl/forms/9Cehw0Uvkry5nWec2More about Sinterit Lisa: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q8al0846stkSee you on 23 March at 3pm for the product launch!
events.location: 3D Printing Studios Asia Pte Ltd, 114 Lavender Street, #01-50 CT Hub 2, Singapore 338729

events.name: Ethereum Singapore presents Golem, Gnosis, Digix, AirSwap & MakerDAO
events.description: Ethereum Singapore presents Golem, Gnosis, Digix, AirSwap & MakerDAO: Golem, the project creating a decentralized global marketplace for computing power, will be touring Asia and has joined forces with several prominent projects in Asia to pull together a series of events. The purpose of this series is to do a deep dive into specific elements that make the blockchain ecosystem so diverse, fascinating and groundbreaking. In the Singapore edition, Golem has joined forces with Digix, MakerDAO, AirSwap and Gnosis. Join these five prominent projects in this edition of Ethereum Singapore where we’ll analyze the following: Token Models & Economics: a gentle guide to the blockchain ecosystem The projects here have very diverse tokens with different functionalities and economics. Through a panel discussion, we will analyze them and showcase the uniqueness of these projects and how blockchain technology makes them all possible. Before the panel, each project will have a short presentation of 5-7 minutes on their project. Panelists - Julian Zawistowski (CEO & Founder) - Golem (https://golem.network)- Martin Köppelman (CEO & Founder) - Gnosis (https://gnosis.pm)- QJ Wang (Asia Lead) - MakerDAO (https://makerdao.com/)- Michael Oved (Co-Founder) - AirSwap (https://www.airswap.io/) Moderator- KC Chng (CEO & Founder) - Digix (https://digix.global)
events.location: Paypal Innovation Lab, 5 Temasek Boulevard #07-01, Suntec Tower 5, Singapore, 038985

events.name: TensorFlow and Deep Learning : ML in the Cloud
events.description: This month, it's FOSSASIA time and we have some guest speakers from Google in town who will be talking about Machine Learning in the Cloud with TensorFlow. Talks for this month's event: 1. Kaz Sato, a Google Staff Developer Advocate - "BigQuery and TensorFlow: Data Warehouse + Machine Learning enables the 'smart' query" - BigQuery is Google's fully managed, petabyte-scale data warehouse. BigQuery's User Defined Function enables 'smart' queries with the power of machine learning, such as similarity search or recommendation on images or documents with feature vectors and neural network prediction. Kaz will demonstrate how BigQuery and TensorFlow enables a powerful "data warehouse + ML" solution. 2. Sara Robinson, Google Developer Advocate, will be presenting on the TensorFlow Object Detection API and how to serve a custom object detection iOS app she built to detect Taylor Swift. She'll cover everything from training a model with transfer learning to serving the model in the cloud, to making prediction requests to the model from an iOS device (in Swift!). 3. Kaggle TensorFlow Speech Recognition Winner: Heng Cher Keng will share his team winning experience in the TensorFlow Speech Recognition Challenge at Kaggle. For this talk, he will describe the use of "knowledge distillation" to fit a high accuracy (but big) ensemble of models to a single small TensorFlow model for implementation in Raspberry Pi3, with little loss in accuracy. 4. At the other end of the computation power spectrum : Chris Auld, who is speaking at FOSSASIA over the weekend, will give a quick overview of how he is using Keras, TensorFlow and the open source Horovod distributed computation platform (which is, according to their benchmarks, more efficient than the Distributed TensorFlow framework). --- Talks will start at 7pm (A/V equipment permitting) and end at around 9pm, at which point people normally come up to the front for a bit of a chat with each other, and the speakers. --- As always, we're actively looking for more speakers for future events - both '30 minutes long-form', and lightning talks. For the lightning talks, we welcome folks to come and talk about something cool they've done with TensorFlow and/or Deep Learning for 5-10mins (so, if you have slides, then #max=10). We believe that the key ingredient for the success of a Lightning Talk is simply the cool/interesting factor. It doesn't matter whether you're an expert or and enthusiastic beginner: Given the responses we have had, we're sure there are lots of people who would be interested to hear what you've been playing with. Please suggest yourself here :https://www.meetup.com/TensorFlow-and-Deep-Learning-Singapore/suggestion/
events.location: Google Asia Pacific, 70 Pasir Panjang Road, #03-71, Mapletree Business City, , Singapore

events.name: Agile Coaching Event @ TS
events.description: About the Event:Titansoft (http://www.titansoft.com/en/) and SG Coaching in Agile (https://tinyurl.com/sgagilecoaching) are joining forces to organize 2nd event on agile coaching. In this event, we have two sharing sessions (talk and Q+A). Session 1:"Setting straight the coaching relationship in Agile coaching for power and ethics” by Giom .As Agile coach we deal with large organisation and often we get lost. Who’s my client? Who am I coaching? Who is judging the progress? Giom will share his experience of the coaching triangle, a concept that help him understand who to talk to and how. Or, sometimes, where did he fail. Session 2:"10 ways worth-a-try, to convince your skeptical stakeholders to go along with you" by Frederic Ducros.In this session, Frederic will share a few ways to likely fail (as he did), then a few mindsets, behaviors, and habits that may help you engage people who have so far doubted, steered away from, or outright opposed your efforts. About the Speaker: Giom (https://www.linkedin.com/in/guillaumeunlimited), a French national has been in Asia for more than two years. Currently he is based in Singapore as independent agile coach, trainer and facilitator. Before being agile coach, he developed his skills in software development. Frederic Ducros (https://www.linkedin.com/in/fredericducros) is Agile/Lean organizational transformation coach, He helps executives and their teams excel in sales, delivery, transformation, product/solution design. Some of his expertise are in Lean 6 Sigma, Lean management, Agile, Simulations, Mock-ups, Roleplays, Storytelling. Agenda:18:45 - 19:05 : Networking19:05 - 19:10 : TS journey in agile19:10 - 19:15 : Introduction of SG Coaching in Agile (https://tinyurl.com/sgagilecoaching)19:15 - 19:50 : Session 1: “Setting straight the coaching relationship in Agile coaching for power and ethics”19:50 - 19:55 Short break19:55 - 20:30 : Session 2: “10 ways worth-a-try, to convince your skeptical stakeholders to go along with you"20:30 - 20:55 : Wrap-up & more social time
events.location: Titansoft, 90 Eu Tong Sen Street, 5F, Singapore

events.name: Kubernetes March 2018 Meetup (FOSSASIA Edition)
events.description: Kubernetes User Group for March 2018 (FOSSASIA Edition) - at Honestbee With FOSSASIA on in Singapore, there are a number of members of the international Kubernetes Community visiting. We usually don't have two meetups in a month but we thought it is a great opportunity to hear from some exciting speakers. Please join us! Topic 1: An Introduction to CNCF - Chris Aniszczyk - CNCF Topic 2: Modern Secrets Management - Seth Vargo - Google Lightning talk: Intro to Kedge - Suraj Narwade Topic 3: Traefik Ingress controller - Michael Bright - Containous Modern Secrets Management Live demos showcasing fundamentals of Vault, then deep-dive into Vault, then show how to consume Vault from K8S. Kedge A tool to help deploy Simple, Concise & Declarative Kubernetes Applications Traefik Ingress controller Overview of Traefik, a modern HTTP reverse proxy and load balancer packed with features such as config hot-reloads, circuit breakers, metrics integrations for Prometheus/Datadog, Let's Encrypt integration,...About the speakers: Seth Vargo is in the fields of DevOps, HashiCorp (Terraform, packer, Vault, consul, etc), and Chef/Puppet. And integrations of GCP tools with these community tools. Michael Bright is Developer Evangelist for the Traefik reverse-proxy/load-balancer, working for Containous France.

events.name: Blockchain: Regulations & Economics of Cryptocurrencies Today
events.description: FIRST 80 PAX: FREE CONSENTIUM PHYSICAL COIN!* In this meet-up, our speakers will be sharing about the regulations and economics of cryptocurrencies today. Nizam Ismail, Partner and Head of Financial Services at RHTLaw Taylor Wessing, will be sharing about the regulations of cryptocurrencies. Peter Sin and Caleb Yap, Co-Founders of Singapore Bitcoin Club, will be discussing the monetisation of messaging apps today. Hal Bame, co-founder of Consentium, will be introducing the app which has recently raised US$10 million from its private sale. There will also be opportunities to network and mingle with one another from the crypto world! Prepare your name cards and join us for an insightful evening with canapés and drinks on us! events.name: Chinatown Pub Crawl with Speakers and Participants of FOSSASIA OpenTech Summit
events.description: Let's get together with speakers and participants of the FOSSASIA OpenTech Summit for a pub, dessert and snack crawl and explore Singapore Sling, Chinese desserts and snacks we find on our way.  Approximate Itinerary: 7:30 - 7:45 Chinatown MRT, towards Exit A, below the escalator, near the red OCBC ATM 7:45 - 8:30 Visit Chinatown Complex Food Centre (Good Beer Company in particular!) 8:30 - 8:45 Walking to Brewerkz 8:45 onwards at Brewerkz Contact Call Roland on +65 9670 0022 if you can't find us! More Info FOSSASIA: http://2018.fossasia.org Brewerkz: http://www.brewerkz.com
events.location: Chinatown MRT, towards Exit A, below the escalator, near the red OCBC ATM, Near Pagoda St, Singapore

events.name: Python 3 programming for beginners (SkillsFuture claimable,with follow up class)

Register here :http://www.solacetech.com.sg/product/python-3-programming-fundamental-and-automation/
